docs.snippet: The war of the politicians continues to wage here smith unabated fury. Californians never do anything by halves. They are intense in their loves and hates; and in political campaigns, or personal controversy, are ultra, bitter and unrelenting.

headline.main: LATER FROM SAN FRANCISCO.; The Gwin and Broderick Contest--Lively Times among the Politicians--Criminal Occurrences--Later from Oregon--The Congressional Election Still Uncertain, &c. By the Overland Mall.

docs.lead_paragraph: The war of the politicians continues to wage here smith unabated fury. Californians never do anything by halves. They are intense in their loves and hates; and in political campaigns, or personal controversy, are ultra, bitter and unrelenting.

docs.snippet: The steamship City of Washington, from Liverpool on the 17th inst., and Cork on the 18th, and consequently bringing five days' later European advice than those by the America at Halifax, and the Etna and Boston, was boarded off cape race on Thursday,...
docs.lead_paragraph: The steamship City of Washington, from Liverpool on the 17th inst., and Cork on the 18th, and consequently bringing five days' later European advice than those by the America at Halifax, and the Etna and Boston, was boarded off cape race on Thursday, by the news-yacht of the Associated Press.

headline.main: THE GREAT FIRE AT NEW-BEDFORD.; Loss over $300,000--Eight to Ten Thousand Barrels of Oil Destroyed.

docs.lead_paragraph: The New-Bedford Standard extra, of Thursday, contains some additional particulars of the destructive fire in that city on Wednesday, Aug. 24. The Srandara says: " The fire broke out at a time when very many of our citizens were participating in the festivities with which they are favored the present week, and the swift destruction of valuable property was appalling.

headline.main: CITY INTELLIGENCE.; THE CITY PUBLIC SCHOOLS. Preparations for Reopening--New Building Improvements, Repairs, &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: BOCUS SEGARS.--The smoking public, or at least such of the smoking public as love to Inhale the perfume of the genuine Havana leaf and detest the base imitations which annually come to us in immense quantities from Vaterland, are warned by a Correspondent against the folly of purchasing segars from itinerant venders.

docs.snippet: To the Editor of the New- York Times: The TIMES of Wednesday and various other City papers, published a telegram from Utica stating that I "was knocked down near Rome, in the amoking car of the Central Railroad. Mr, CLRVELAND accused his assailant of...
docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor of the New- York Times: The TIMES of Wednesday and various other City papers, published a telegram from Utica stating that I "was knocked down near Rome, in the amoking car of the Central Railroad. Mr, CLRVELAND accused his assailant of stealing his baggage." That I was struck Is true, but that L accused my assaliant of stealing my baggage is false.

docs.snippet: Be it known to all men by these presents--by presents I of course mean the service of silver plate with which the proprietors of the TIMES will present me when they read this letter-be it known, therefore, by these presents that I-Jack Robinson-am at...
docs.lead_paragraph: Be it known to all men by these presents--by presents I of course mean the service of silver plate with which the proprietors of the TIMES will present me when they read this letter-be it known, therefore, by these presents that I-Jack Robinson-am at Nahant.

docs.snippet: Soon after the organization of our Government it became apparent to its founders that though remote from the Old Continent, our distance might not avert a participation in the wars that the French Revolution had spread over the rest of Christendom;...

headline.main: AFFAIRS IN VIRGINIA.; National Coast Defences--Fortresses Monroe and Calhoun--Present Condition of these Works--Trial of New Rifle Canon--Reception at Villa Margarete--Lieutenant-Governor Montague--Botts' Stock Rising in Virginia--Belles and Beaux of the Hygeia--Yacht Haswell of Providence.

docs.lead_paragraph: Soon after the organization of our Government it became apparent to its founders that though remote from the Old Continent, our distance might not avert a participation in the wars that the French Revolution had spread over the rest of Christendom; and accordingly a very large amount of money was expended on forts and batteries at the principal sea-port towns.

docs.snippet: THE OATH OF A HORST-THIEF.--Two men, D. A. Rouse and J. E. HOLLY, from Cincinnati, were sent to prison in Louisville, a few days since, on suspicion of horse stealing, having shipped a fine stallion the day previous. ROUSH's conduct, such as...
docs.lead_paragraph: THE OATH OF A HORST-THIEF.--Two men, D. A. Rouse and J. E. HOLLY, from Cincinnati, were sent to prison in Louisville, a few days since, on suspicion of horse stealing, having shipped a fine stallion the day previous. ROUSH's conduct, such as appearing in false whiskers and the like, caused his arrest.

docs.snippet: A MARRIAGE AND ITS RESULTS.--CECILIA PFEISHER, a German woman about 45 years of age, of the Hebrew faith, appeared before Justice BEENMAN yesterday, and preferred charges of as fault and battery and larceny against KING SCHOENFELD, also a German and...
docs.lead_paragraph: A MARRIAGE AND ITS RESULTS.--CECILIA PFEISHER, a German woman about 45 years of age, of the Hebrew faith, appeared before Justice BEENMAN yesterday, and preferred charges of as fault and battery and larceny against KING SCHOENFELD, also a German and a Jew, Louis and ABRAHAM SOHOENFELD, hisons, and a man named SCHWARTZ.
